text: Hugo Alvar Henrik Aalto (3 February 1898 – 11 May 1976 "Aalto, Alvar." Encyclopædia Britannica. 17 Dec. 2006.) was a Finnish architect who made many important contributions to architecture. Sometimes he is called the "Father of Modernism". == Life == Alvar Aalto was born in Kuortane, Finland.http://www.greatbuildings.com/architects/Alvar_Aalto.html Retrieved on 9 October 2007 He studied architecture at the Technical University of Helsinki from 1916 to 1921.http://scandinaviandesign.com/Alvar_Aalto/ Retrieved on 9 October 2007 He returned to Jyväskylä, where he opened his first architectural office in 1923. Alvar Aalto died in May 11, 1976, in Helsinki. == Other websites == * Alvar Aalto Foundation Custodian of Aalto's architectural drawings and writings. * Aalto bibliography - From the official site * Alvar Aalto - Design Dictionary Illustrated article about Alvar Aalto * Alvar Aalto's Savoy Vase (1936) == References == Category:1898 births Category:1976 deaths Category:Architects Category:Finnish people
